How can patients be assisted so that they can have a positive impact on their own recovery, including after the treatment itself? (Shoulder)

Why are a large number of joint-maintaining operations (pedicled scaphoid bone splint, ligament surgery, partial resection….) carried out on the wrist even though this does not result in pain-free outcomes for many patients? (Hand)
How can chronically injured cartilage be regenerated, and how can freedom from pain and restored function be achieved for the patient? (Cartilage)
How does strength training affect finger and wrist arthrosis?
Does craniosacral therapy, in addition to hand therapy interventions, have a pain-reducing effect in patients with CRPS (complex regional pain syndrome) affecting the hand? (Hand)

In patients with conservatively treated CTS (Carpal Tunnel Syndrome), is there a difference with regard to nocturnal pain and paresthesia between those treated with a palmar splint versus those treated with a dorsopalmar splint? (Hand)
Is the average healing process slowed down by immobilization and especially increased administration of pain medication?
What influence do tactile stimuli, such as effleurage, brushing, lentil baths, etc. have on pain processing and edema reduction?
What role does osteopathic treatment play in complex regional pain syndrome?
How can burns be treated as quickly and painlessly as possible?
What is the long-term effect of optimal pain management on treatment success?
What can be done to remove chronic pain, or at least make it bearable?
How is it possible to develop body part prostheses that function as naturally and completely as possible? (Musculoskeletal system)
What are the areas of improvement and/or improved devices that could be introduced when responding to accidental injuries?
What is the effect of laser therapy on brain injuries caused by head trauma? (Head)

Is it possible to replace broken bones with something similar to bone? (Bones)
In what way can medical technology be used to enhance/speed up the efficiency and duration of healing accidental injuries?

How can innovative bone fracture treatment techniques be combined with modern imaging (3D, augmented reality, etc.) with the goal of standardization, evidence, minimization of complications and outcome, specifically in minimally invasive procedures, new repositioning techniques and new implants? (Bones)

For many accidental injuries, metal is used during surgery. Would it be possible to instead use an artificial bone material that would leave no restrictions and integrate perfectly into human bones? (Bones)
Is the introduction of additional biocompatible substances (e.g. bone cement) during the surgical treatment of bone fractures beneficial for healing? (Bones)

Alternative, modern prostheses for destroyed limbs that can be used as realistically as possible.
Is it possible for a patient to recover after an accident that caused a spinal cord injury to the extent that they are able to walk again? (Nervous system)
What is the role of strengthening exercise in the healing process for rotator cuff injuries? (Restoration of daily life)
What are the most important follow-up steps after hand replantation? (Hand)
What are the most important therapeutic treatment techniques for the resolution of scarring? (Scars)
How does hand-therapy assistance after amputation injuries to the hand affect the duration of sick leave? (Paraplegia or amputation)

What effects do passive mobilization therapy and active therapy with medical muscle training and equipment-based training have on healing success/secondary accidents? Are 60-minute therapy units more promising than 30 minutes, and is there a connection here? (Musculoskeletal system)
Does work simulation during hand therapy facilitate the return to professional activities of patients with complex hand injuries? (Hand)

Is there a difference with regard to active range of movement after finger fractures depending on whether dynamically progressive Quengel splinting or statically progressive Quengel splinting is used as a therapeutic intervention? (Hand)

With surgically treated zone 5 extensor tendon injuries, is there a difference with regard to hand function between ICAM (immediate controlled active motion) and controlled passive early mobilization as per Evans? (Hand)
With zone 2 flexor tendon injuries, is there a difference in hand function after active early functional follow-up versus the "HILEI" system? (Hand)

After finger fractures, do patients who are treated with static progressive Quengel splinting with a continuous wearing period of at least 6 hours have a greater active degree of movement than those who wear the same splint in separate periods (3 x 2h)? (Hand)

After complex hand injuries, do patients have better hand function if they also receive garden therapy in addition to hand therapy interventions, in comparison to patients who only receive hand therapy interventions? (Hand)
After complex hand injuries, do patients have better hand function if they receive an occupation-based intervention in addition to hand therapy interventions? (Hand)

After metacarpal fracture of the hand, do patients treated according to the spiral dynamic concept with a focus on the arch of the hand have better hand function than patients treated with conventional hand therapy interventions? (Hand)
Can CMC (carpometacarpal) 1 arthrosis of the hand, stage 1 and 2 as per Eaton and Littler, be prevented from progressing with hand therapy interventions? (Hand)
How does job-specific training and treatment during rehabilitation affect the return to professional life after an accident? (Restoration of daily life)
In what way does setting rehabilitation measures in the direct environment influence the effects of the rehabilitation process on the outcome of rehabilitation?
What is the relationship between successful healing and time to implementation of rehabilitation measures (physiotherapy, occupational therapy) in musculoskeletal injuries? (Musculoskeletal system)
How do I activate my innate regeneration of bone in the body and teeth? (Bones)

What treatment options are there for multiple cruciate ligament tears? (Ligaments & tendons)
